Sentencas: Reversible solid oxide cell (RSOC) technology allows use of a single device to efficiently derive chemicals from power (power-to-fuel) and power from chemicals (fuel-to-power).
Titulo: Novel Composite Fuel Electrode for CO2/CO-RSOCs

Sentencas: Fuel flexibility is a key aspect, as developing SOCs able to operate on fuels other than hydrogen can ease their integration into existing infrastructure.
Titulo: Novel Composite Fuel Electrode for CO2/CO-RSOCs

Sentencas: In addition, H2O and/or CO2 reduction is favorable in SOECs as polarization losses are reduced at high temperature.
Titulo: Novel Composite Fuel Electrode for CO2/CO-RSOCs

Sentencas: Here, a composite fuel electrode, 60 wt.% La0.6Sr0.4Fe0.8Mn0.2O3-delta (LSFMn) and 40 wt.% (5 wt.% Ni)-containing Ce0.85Sm0.15O2-delta (Ni-SDC) was investigated in H-2-fueled, CO-fueled SOFCs and for CO2 reduction in SOEC mode.
Titulo: Novel Composite Fuel Electrode for CO2/CO-RSOCs

Sentencas: In reducing conditions, Fe exsolved from the LSFMn perovskite formed a Ni-Fe alloy with Ni present on SDC.
Titulo: Novel Composite Fuel Electrode for CO2/CO-RSOCs

Sentencas: The composite fuel electrode showed remarkable activity for CO2 reduction with a current density output of 1.40 A cm(-2) (1.5 V) at 850 degrees C. SOFC/SOEC cell reversibility was obtained in different CO2:CO mixtures.
Titulo: Novel Composite Fuel Electrode for CO2/CO-RSOCs

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy analysis was used to better understand cell mechanisms in SOFC and SOEC mode.
Titulo: Novel Composite Fuel Electrode for CO2/CO-RSOCs
